did.unittitle: Indiana University Vice President and Dean of the Faculties records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Indiana University. Vice President and Dean of the Faculties.

did.abstract: Herman T. Briscoe was the first Dean of Faculties at Indiana University. The new position assumed some of the responsibilties once overseen by the university president. This collection consists of correspondence, reports, committee files, minutes, and memos.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Several files have been restricted because of a few sensitive documents in each folder; however, there are other materials in the folders that are not restricted and are of research value. These files can still be requested for use and the restricted materials will be removed at that time.
Restricted files are listed where they would fall in the intellectual organization of the collection but are physically located at the end of the collection in Boxes 13-23.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Dean of the Faculties Office was created in May 1940 with the purpose of overseeing the administration of academic affairs. Previously these duties were performed by the President's Office. In creating this office, university president Herman B Wells hoped to distribute his duties, particularly during his absences, by giving the Dean of the Faculties responsibility for undertaking some of the public appearances, acting on academic problems and proposals, and serving as a member of all university faculty groups. Budget control was the primary responsibility assigned to the Dean of the Faculties. In this, the Dean controlled all academic budgets and played a key role in the development of annual budgets.

Herman Thompson Briscoe (1893-1960) earned the reputation as one of Indiana University's most capable, talented, and valuable educators and administrators. Born in 1893, his long association with IU began in 1912 as a student. He went on to receive his A.B. in chemistry in 1917, his M.A. in 1923 and his PhD in 1924. He went on to remain at IU in various capacities within the Chemistry Department: Instructor in Chemistry, 1922- 24; Assistant Professor, 1924-26; Associate Professor, 1926-28; Professor, 1928-1960, and from 1938-1941 he served as chairman of the department.

Briscoe moved into University administration when he participated as secretary on the Self-Survey Committee appointed by President Wells. The report of this committee helped reorganize the university's administration. In 1939 President Wells created the Office of Student Guidance. He named Briscoe Director of Student Guidance as a Special Administrative Assistant to the President from 1939-1942, which he did simultaneously with his duties as Chemistry Department Chairman, 1938-1941. As part of his counseling duties, Briscoe travelled to the regional campuses and served as a member of committees concerning students such as the Committee for Residence Halls and the Scholarships and Student Aid Committee. In 1940 Briscoe was appointed the first Dean of the Faculties, his title one year later changing to Vice President and Dean of the Faculties.

In December 1942, Briscoe was called upon by Paul V. McNutt to serve with him on the War Manpower Commission, representing the institutions of higher education which hosted military training programs and had responsibility for postwar educational planning. By 1943 he was spending most of his time in Washington D.C., which prompted I.U. to appoint an acting Deans of the Faculties. In 1944 Briscoe was promoted to the Director of the War Manpower Training Bureau, a position he held until he retired in 1959.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Vice President and Dean of the Faculties records are organized into five series: Chronological subject files, General subject files, Committee on Administrative Research, Chronological files, and Inter-University Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the administrative records of Herman T. Briscoe during his tenure as Vice President and Dean of the Faculties, 1940-1959. In addition to Briscoe's papers, those of his assistants, Robert T. Ittner and Ralph L. Collins, are also present in small numbers throughout the collection.

The Vice President and Dean of the Faculties records are organized into five series: Chronological subject files, General subject Files, Committee on Administrative Research, Chronological files, and Inter-University Committee.

The first series, Chronological subject files (1940-1957), is arranged chronologically by academic year and within, the files are arranged alphabetically by folder heading. The records primarily consist of reports, memos, meeting minutes, and correspondence reflecting Briscoe's activities as an officer of Indiana University serving on various committees, corresponding with the heads of departments and deans of I.U.'s various schools and divisions, and discussing personnel matters. In December 1942 Dean Briscoe was appointed to the War Manpower Commission in Washington D.C. and took two leaves of absence from IU. During these periods the university appointed an Acting Dean of the Faculties, Professor A. L. Kohlmeier of the History Department, from February to April 1943, and Professor Ford P. Hall of the Government Department during the 1943-1944 academic year. The records from the Dean of the Faculties Office during these years are present in this collection and reflect the continued activity of the office. Both Kohlmeier and Hall received and acted upon correspondence intended for Dean Briscoe and both corresponded with Dean Briscoe on university matters.

The second series, General subject files span 1944-1959 and are few in number. These files do not differ in content from the Chronological subject files but after the 1944-1945 school year, the office discontinued the practice of creating new subject files each academic year. Several files have been restricted due to a few sensitive documents in each folder, however, much of the material in these files contains research value and can be used if requested well in advance so that staff may remove the restricted materials.

The third series, Chronological files (1946-1959), contains incoming and outgoing correspondence, reports, memos, and some meeting minutes from the Dean of the Faculties Office. The materials are arranged by the month and year in which they were created. The majority of the records are from the period 1951-1957 and reflect the activity of all the members of the Dean of the Faculties Office. This series has been restricted due to a few sensitive documents in each folder, however, much of the material in these files contains research value and can be used if requested well in advance so that staff may remove the restricted materials.

The fourth series, Committee on Administrative Research (1944-1951), contains files from the Dean of Faculties Office while Briscoe, Ittner, and Collins were members of this committee: Briscoe as Chairman, 1944-1946; Ittner as Secretary, 1946-1948; and Collins as Chairman, 1949-1951.

The fifth and final series, Inter-University Committee, is comprised of the reports, statistical analyses, and correspondence files of Dean Briscoe during his involvement with this committee. The committee was directed by representatives of the four state schools: Indiana University, Purdue University, Indiana State University, and Ball State University. Its purpose was to calculate a budget formula that could be utilized by the Indiana State Legislature in apportioning funds to the four universities. Dean Briscoe chaired this committee in from 1951-1952. The series is arranged chronologically and alphabetically within each year.
Note: Restricted files are listed where they would fall in the intellectual organization of the collection but are physically located at the end of the collection in Boxes 13-23.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: For further information on the Inter-University Committee, please see the Inter-Institutional Study Committee records, 1941-1961: http://purl.dlib.indiana.edu/iudl/findingaids/archives/InU-Ar-VAA2019

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyrights for records originating with Indiana University administrative units, departments, and other offices are held by the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Indiana University Vice President and Dean of the Faculties records, Collection C26, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: First processed by Kristina Gray Perez; revised and finding aid updated in 2011 by Amanda Hunt.
